page.title: 14Farming-Dairying-Old Bourtie
page.content: Old Bourtie is one part of a much larger family unit.This part of the unit is totally given over to dairying.All Mr J Cooper's land is in grass,approx.half for silage,the rest for grazing for his herd of 100 Friesian cows. Mr.Cooper has a computerised herring bone milking parlour where the amount of milk a cow yields is recorded automatically and the correct amount of concentrates is deposited in a trough for the cow to eat. The huge custom built shed for housing the cows has two main areas,a feeding area and a sleeping area.Here the cows wander about at their ease. The silage is taken to troughs by a conveyor belt.The slurry is transported from a huge pit under the floor by a giant hose to a storage tank outside for use as fertiliser.
